meanings.sent1: Farming requires a lot of labour in the fields.
meanings.sent2: Construction workers put in long hours of labour every day.
meanings.sent3: The ants showed impressive teamwork in their labour to build the anthill.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her craft was evident in the meticulous labour she put into each piece.
meanings.sent5: The miners' faces were covered in sweat and dirt after a hard day's labour underground.

meanings.sent1: The expectant mother was in labour for several hours before giving birth.
meanings.sent2: The midwife assisted the woman during her labour in the delivery room.
meanings.sent3: The comedy movie had a scene where the man comically panicked during his wife's labour.
meanings.sent4: The miracle of life unfolds during the intense labour of childbirth.
meanings.sent5: The hospital staff was well-prepared to handle any complications during labour.

meanings.sent1: She had to labour all night to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The students laboured over their homework assignments until late in the evening.
meanings.sent3: Despite the rain, the team continued to labour on the construction site.
meanings.sent4: The artist laboured over every brushstroke to perfect the painting.
meanings.sent5: He laboured tirelessly to provide for his family and achieve his dreams.

meanings.definition: To give birth to a child
meanings.sent1: The mother laboured for hours before finally delivering a healthy baby.
meanings.sent2: The doctor assisted the woman as she laboured to bring her child into the world.
meanings.sent3: The mare laboured in the stable, preparing to give birth to a foal.
meanings.sent4: The queen laboured to ensure the safe arrival of the future heir to the throne.
meanings.sent5: The mother's strength shone through as she laboured through the pains of childbirth.
